about.name: Michael Hill
about.summary: Multitasking Systems Engineer and Technical/CAP Lead with skills in scripting automation, application and OS troubleshooting/patching and server security mitigations looking for a challenging and fulfilling role to further my skills in project leadership, systems engineering, systems/OS administration and/or IT security.  With more than 13 years of combined experience (Air Force, and contractor positions with NASA and Army), I bring analytical knowledge, attention to detail, skill, a collaborative mindset, conflict resolution and determination to any project, producing quality solutions and products.

projects.name: Precision Fires Manager (PFM)
projects.role: CAP Lead and Software Systems Engineer
projects.description: PFM is a communication application designed to connect persistent survellant systems with smart munitions for the Army.
work: Senior member on a team of 3 CAP Leads
Assist SW Manager and Chief Architect in leading a team of 12 developers and 4 testers
Plan and coordinate software releases for PFM
Create and Prioritize Capability Assessment Packages (CAPs) for releases
Plan and create tasks for developers and testers on the team
Create and maintain software release documentation (SDD, ICD, SRS, etc.)
Create, maintain and brief status updates to management
Lead requirements analysis and schedule management
Provide input and review PFM-related documentation (STD, STP, PP, FHA, PHA, etc.)
Coordinate changes to project schedule, milestones and documentation
Create and update design models and documentation
Assess critical issues and provide impact analysis
Provide input for CAP risk assessment and risk mitigation
accomplishments: Assisted in the implementation and release of the PFM v1.0.0.0 application

projects.name: NASA EAST2 Contract
projects.description: Employed to build, maintain and upgrade multiple application environments, ensuring 99.9% or better uptime with an emphasis on availability, reliability, scalability, data confidentiality and system integrity.
work: Perform application and server tests to validate operations
Create and maintain server scripts to perform and report various tasks and statuses
Train co-workers on new applications
Provide on-call support as required
Analyze and reduce performance issues with NASA applications and servers
Validate and migrate developer code to different enrivonments (dev, test, stage, production)
Coordinate and schedule NASA application activities
Perform software patching and OS kernel updates
Diagnose and resolve application, server and certificate vulnerabilities
Designed new RHEL architecture and created UML diagram documentation
Increased application uptime by developing automation for server reboots, post patching activities
Analyze database queries for reports and issues within the applications
Maintain privileges access to servers and applications
SharePoint administration and site design experience
Create and update documentation for applications, scans, daily tasks, vulnerabilities (POA&Ms) and Root-Cause analyses
Analyze current application and OS setup for possible architecture improvements
Design and create application logos per customer requirements
accomplishments: MSFC CIO Achiever Award for the implementation of EZMax Mobile
MSFC Group Achievement Award for the EZMax Mobile Team

projects.name: NASA MITS Contract
projects.description: Remedy and Maximo are ticketing applications that provide: incident, problem, knowledge, change, release, asset, configuration and service level management; while providing the users with smart reporting capabilities.
work: Create and maintain development documentation for testing and reports for management and NASA customers
Train customers to use the Remedy and Maximo applications
Provide customer support for incidents and other technical issues
Design, plan and execute RHEL architecture VM migrations
Design and execute Remedy high-availability architecture upgrade
Implement Remedy internal health monitor utility
Monitor server and application performance
Design and create application logos per customer requirements
Provide project status updates to management and team members
accomplishments: Certificate of Team Appreciation for the BMC Remedy v9.0 Upgrade Project

experience.company: United States Air Force - Air National Guard (ANG)

projects.name: 118th AW: Client Systems Operations (3D1X1) in Nashville, TN
projects.description: Computer networking specialist, responsible for deployment, sustainment, troubleshooting and repair of standard voice, data, video and cryptographic client devices.
work: Lead small team of 2 Client Operators and reported statuses to Chief Client Operator
Provide customer support with BMC Remedy application
Maintained user records and access privileges using Active Directory
Create and maintain firewall and security protocols for base network
Maintain applications on base by configuring and applying regular security patches
Create and maintain base network diagrams for SolarWinds (computers, printers, faxes and phones)
Train personnel on system administration

projects.name: 225th CBCS: Technical Controlman (3C2X1) in Gadsden, AL
projects.description: Monitor and control performance of networks and communications-computer systems (C-CS). Coordinates configuration, operation, restoration and service improvements, as well as to analyze capabilities & performance, identify problems and take corrective actions to resolve any issue that arises.
work: Network administrator using Active Directory to manage user access
Install and configure Cisco routers, switches and hubs across base
Install and test server hardware for upgrades
Secure-wiped obsolete computers and harddrives per DoD regulations
Maintain database records and server backups
Perpare 225th CBCS Base for closure

education.degree: B.S. in Computer Science with minor in Mathematics

education.school: Community College of the Air Force (CCAF)
